alert.note: Alert for De Baca County; Eastern Lincoln County; Guadalupe County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 2:42PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN LINCOLN, SOUTHWESTERN DE BACA AND SOUTHWESTERN GUADALUPE COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM MDT... At 241 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Ramon, or 24 miles southeast of Vaughn, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Yeso and Ramon. This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 175 and 188. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 292 and 310. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.

area.areaDesc: De Baca County; Eastern Lincoln County; Guadalupe County
